entry.title: Yoshino View
entry.content:
View of the Yoshino area from about half way down Yoshino Mountain yesterday. Kinpusen-ji is in the center of the photo.

We took a taxi to the top and spent much of the day walking down. Was impressed by the large number of people of all ages walking up the narrow road, that was quite steep at times.

entry.title: Kyoto Art in Two Photos
entry.content:
Kyoto art in two photos, from today: Above: A room at Ninna-ji, a temple established in the 9th century, although this room was created around 1905.

Below: Multimedia Art installation by Teppei Kaneuji in the former printing plant of Kyoto Shimbun newspaper, for the Kyotographie international photo festival.

entry.title: Evening at Shogunzuka
entry.content:
Cherry blossom garden lightup at Shogunzuka (将軍塚), in Kyoto's eastern hills.

One of the main attractions of Shogunzuka is the city view from its giant outdoor platform. In the last photo at bottom center you can see the area around the Shijo Bridge (四条大橋). Tonight however, the garden made for a better photo.
entry.summary: Cherry blossom garden lightup at Shogunzuka (将軍塚), in Kyoto's eastern hills.

entry.title: Paddling With Sakura
entry.content: We took a cruise on Osaka's O River near the Mint building, where the banks are covered with cherry trees. A great day for a standup paddleboard session.
